nodes.text: Organoid Maturation Medium（in 50mL):24.5 ml Advanced DMEM/F12, 24.5 ml Neurobasal medium, 500 μl GlutaMax (stock concentration: 100X, final concentration: 1X), 500 μl B-27 supplement minus Vitamin A (stock concentration: 50X, final concentration 0.5X), 250 μl N-2 supplement (stock concentration: 100X, final concentration: 0.5X), 91 μl 2-Mercaptoethanol (final concentration: 0.1 mM), and 100 μl Normocin (stock concentration: 50 mg/ml, final concentration: 100 μg/ml)
32 ml of E8 medium with 64 μl of Normocin (Final concentration of 100 μg/ml)
Day (-2): Cell aggregation (for 2 plates of 96-well plate)
10 ml of medium to 15 ml conical tube
22 ml of medium to 50 ml conical tube
add 10 μl of Y
add 44 μl of Y
Cell dissociation
Aspirate spent medium of the cells in one well of a 6-well culture plate
Wash with 2.5 ml of 1X DPBS twice, and aspirate the DPBS from the last wash.
Add 500 μl of Accutase
Incubate for 3-4 mins in a 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2
shake the plate horizontally and check under a microscope to confirm that the cells are all detached from the surface of the plate

If clusters of adhered cells are still present, incubate extra 20 seconds to 1 minute (total 4 minutes), based on the percentage of adherent cell portion, until the cells are fully detached and partially single-celled.
Using a 5 ml serological pipette, aliquot 5 ml of E8-10Y to a sterile 15 ml tube（Tube #1）

Using 3 ml from last step E8-10Y with a 5 ml serological pipette, gently pipette up-and-down to break up the cell clusters into single cells in the well where cells were detached by Accutase treatment
Collect all cell suspension back into the Tube #1 with a final volume at 5.5 ml.
Centrifuge for 5 minutes and 30 seconds at 230 rcf at room temperature to pellet cells.
Carefully and completely remove the supernatant by aspiration. Tilt the tube to flow the medium away from the pellet for aspiration
Using a p1000 tip, resuspend cells in 1 ml of E8-10Y by gently pipetting up and down
Cell aggregation
To equilibrate the cell strainer, forcefully pipette 1 ml of E8-10Y medium through the cell strainer mesh.
Pipette resuspended cells in E8-10Y onto the cell strainer in a drop-wise manner
Rinse the conical tube, where the cells were resuspended and transferred, with 1 ml of E8-10Y medium and pipette onto the cell strainer in a drop-wise manner
Carefully remove and discard the cell strainer snap cap
Prepare 50 μl of Trypan blue in a 500 μl tube
Using a p1000 tip, pipette up and down the cell suspension in the test tube to mix evenly

Immediately, using a p200 tip, collect 50 μl of cell suspension from the center of the volume in the test tube, and transfer it into the 50 μl of Trypan blue prepared ahead - this makes 1:1 dilution of the cells and Trypan blue.
Carefully pipette up-and-down to evenly mix the cells with trypan blue
Add 11 μl of Cell:Trypan blue mixture into both sides of the cell counting chamber slide for Invitrogen Countess II automated counter or on the hemocytometer

Calculate the volume of cell suspension needed for cell culture. The final cell concentration of 35,000 cells/ml is needed for a differentiation culture. Therefore, in 22 ml, 7.7 x 105 cells are needed

Remove the same volume with the cell suspension that is needed for culture from the 22 ml of E8-20Y medium that was prepared earlier, and then, add the adequate volume of your cell suspension to that E8-20Y medium.
Invert several times or swirl the tube to mix the cell suspension evenly.
Pour the 22 ml cell suspension into a 25 ml reservoir
Using a multi-channel pipette, aliquot 100 μl of cell suspension into each of 96-well U-bottom plates
Spin down the plates at 110 rcf for 6 min at room temperature
Incubate the plates in a 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2 for 24 hours.
Day (-1): Dilution of Y solution
Pour 22 ml of fresh E8 medium into a 25 ml reservoir
22 ml of fresh E8 medium containing 44 μl of Normocin (WITHOUT Y)
Using a multichannel pipette, add 100 μl of E8 medium into each well, which brings total volume to 200 μl per well.
Incubate the plates in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2 for 24 hours
Differentiation Day 0: Transition to differentiation in E6 medium (perform all procedures on ice)
E6 medium containing 2% Matrigel, 10 μM SB, 4 ng/ml FGF, and 2.5 ng/ml BMP4 - hereafter, E6SFB
A day before, thaw 600 μl of Matrigel on ice overnight at 4°C.
Prepare 30 ml of E6 medium containing 60 μl of Normocin and keep on ice
To make 2% Matrigel (Final concentration, v/v) in 30 ml of E6 medium, remove 600 μl of E6 medium prepared above, and then, add 600 μl of Matrigel o Add 30 μl of SB, 0.6 μl of FGF, and 0.75 μl of BMP4
Invert several times to mix evenly and keep on ice.
Prepare 3 ml of E6 medium in a 15 ml falcon tube for washing step
Transition into differentiation medium
Collect all aggregates from 96-well U-bottom plates to a 2 ml round-bottom tube
Carefully remove excessive E8 medium from the tube
Wash with 1 ml of E6 medium for three times to completely remove traces of E8 medium
Add 1 ml of E6SFB medium to the tube containing aggregates
Add 1 ml of E6SFB medium to the tube containing aggregates
Using a W-O p1000 tip, transfer all aggregates, including 1 ml of E6SFB, to the petri-dish containing 15 ml of E6SFB on ice.
Use extra 1 ml of E6SFB medium to collect and transfer any remaining aggregates in the tube to the petri-dish.
Using a W-O p200 tip, transfer individual aggregate in 100 μl of E6SFB medium into each well in a new 96-well U-bottom plate
Incubate in 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2
Differentiation Day 3: LDN193189 and basic-FGF treatment
LDN and FGF will be treated in a volume of 25 μl per well, making fi nal volume of 125 μl in each well in 96-well U-bottom plates
5X of LDN and FGF (final concentration) will be prepared in the medium; 1 μM LDN (200 nM) and 250 ng/ml FGF (50 ng/ml).
Make E6 medium containing 1 μM LDN and 250 ng/ml FGF – hereafter, E6LF
Prepare 5 ml of E6 medium containing 10 μl of Normocin o Add 0.5 μl of LDN and 6.25 μl of FGF
Pour 5 ml of prepared E6LF medium into a 10 ml reservoir
Using a multichannel pipette, add 25 μl of the E6LF medium per well into the aggregate culture in 96- well U-bottom plates.
Gently tap the plates to mix the medium
Incubate in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2.
Differentiation Day 6: Providing nutrition
11 ml of E6 medium containing 22 μl of Normocin. Fresh E6 medium containing Normocin will be added at 75 μl per well, making the final volume of 200 μl per well
Pour 11 ml of prepared E6 medium into a 10 ml reservoir
Using a multichannel pipette, add 75 μl per well into each well in 96-well U-bottom plates, making a fi nal volume of 200 μl per well.
Gently tap the plates to mix the medium
Incubate in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2.
Differentiation Day 8: Otic vesicle induction by CHIR99021 treatment

100 μl of spent medium will be removed, and fresh E6 medium containing Normocin and CHIR99021 (hereafter, CHIR, stock concentration: 10 mM) will be added at 100 μl per well, making a final volume of 200 μl; CHIR will be treated at a fi nal concentration of 3 μM in a fi nal volume of 200 μl per well. Therefore, prepare 2X concentrated CHIR (6 μM) in the medium that will be added into each well

Using a multichannel pipette and W-O p200 tips, at about 60 ̊angle, very carefully remove 100 μl of spent medium from each well of 96-well U-bottom plate, remaining 100 μl of spent medium in each well
Pour all E6-2XCH medium into a 25 ml reservoir
Make 15 ml of E6 medium containing 30 μl of Normocin and 9 μl of CHIR and mix well by inverting – hereafter, E6-2XCH
Using a multichannel pipette and regular p200 tips, add 100 μl of fresh E6-2XCH medium into each well, making the final volume of 200 μl and final CHIR concentration of 3 μM
Gently tap the plates to mix the medium
Incubate in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2
Differentiation Day 10: Continued otic vesicle induction by CHIR treatment

Using a multichannel pipette and W-O p200 tips, at about 60 ̊angle, very carefully remove 100 μl of spent medium from each well of 96-well U-bottom plate, remaining 100 μl of spent medium in each well.
Pour all E6-1XCH medium into a 25 ml reservoir.
Make E6 medium containing 3 μM CHIR (1X) – hereafter, E6-1XCH
Using a multichannel pipette and W-O p200 tips, at an angle of 60 ̊, very carefully remove spent medium from each well.
Using a multichannel pipette, add 100 μl of fresh E6-1XCH medium per well into the aggregate culture in 96-well U-bottom plates
Gently tap the plates to mix the medium.
Incubate in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2.
Differentiation Day 12: Transition to fl oating culture in maturation medium / continued otic vesicle induction by CHIR treatment
Prepare OM containing 1% Matrigel and 3 μM CHIR – hereafter, OM1%M-CH
Using a W-O p1000 tip, collect all aggregates in a 2 ml round bottom tube
Carefully remove the excessive medium
Wash aggregates with 1 ml of Advanced DMEM/F12 medium 3 times.
After removing all excessive washing medium, place the tube with aggregates on ice
Add 1 ml of OM1%M-CH into the tube containing aggregates
Pour medium (fi rst pour about 15 ml of OM1%M-CH and keep adding as it goes) into cooled petri- dish on ice.

Using a W-O p1000 tip, collect all aggregates that are in 1 ml of OM1%M-CH, and transfer into the
OM1%M-CH prepared in petri-dish on ice
Using a W-O p1000 tip, transfer each aggregate in 500 μl of OM1%M-CH into each well in 24-well low- attachment plates (i.e. one aggregate per well in the total volume of 500 μl per well).
Gently swirl to make sure each well is completely covered by medium and aggregates are not floating on the surface of the medium.
Incubate in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2.
Differentiation Day 15: Half medium change with OM containing 1% Matrigel and 3 μM CHIR / continued otic vesicle induction
32 ml of OM1%M-CH：To make 1% Matrigel (final concentration, v/v) in 32 ml of OM, remove 320 μl (volume of Matrigel) of OM, and then, add 320 μl of Matrigel.Then, add 9.6 μl CHIR
Remove 250 μl of spent medium from each well of the 24-well plates, leaving 250 μl per well.
Add 250 μl of freshly prepared OM1%M-CH into each well, making a fi nal volume of 500 μl per well.
Gently swirl the plates to mix the medium
Incubate in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2
Differentiation Day 18: Half medium change for Matrigel dilution
Remove 250 μl of spent medium from each well of the 24-well low-attachment plates, leaving 250 μl per well.
Add 250 μl of freshly prepared OM into each well, making the fi nal volume of 500 μl per well
Gently swirl the plates to evenly mix the medium
Incubate in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2

From differentiation day 18 onward, perform a full medium change once every week by completely removing medium (500 μl) from each well and adding back fresh OM (500 μl). Within that one-week period, for experiments up to differentiation day 45, perform half-medium changes every three days (i.e. Full-medium change on Monday, half-medium changes on Thursday and Sunday, then full-medium change on Tuesday). For longer experiments, i.e. after differentiation day 45, perform half medium changes every other day. Also, based on the organoid sizes (i.e. larger) and medium consumption rate (i.e. color of medium changing to yellow), increase total volume to 1 ml per well to provide proper nutrition.

source.text: Differentiation Day 12: Transition to fl oating culture in maturation medium / continued otic vesicle induction by CHIR treatment

target.text: Using a W-O p1000 tip, collect all aggregates in a 2 ml round bottom tube

source.text: Using a W-O p1000 tip, collect all aggregates in a 2 ml round bottom tube

target.text: Carefully remove the excessive medium

source.text: Carefully remove the excessive medium

target.text: Wash aggregates with 1 ml of Advanced DMEM/F12 medium 3 times.

source.text: Wash aggregates with 1 ml of Advanced DMEM/F12 medium 3 times.

target.text: After removing all excessive washing medium, place the tube with aggregates on ice

source.text: After removing all excessive washing medium, place the tube with aggregates on ice

target.text: Add 1 ml of OM1%M-CH into the tube containing aggregates

source.text: Prepare OM containing 1% Matrigel and 3 μM CHIR – hereafter, OM1%M-CH

target.text: Add 1 ml of OM1%M-CH into the tube containing aggregates

source.text: Add 1 ml of OM1%M-CH into the tube containing aggregates

target.text: Pour medium (fi rst pour about 15 ml of OM1%M-CH and keep adding as it goes) into cooled petri- dish on ice.

source.text: Pour medium (fi rst pour about 15 ml of OM1%M-CH and keep adding as it goes) into cooled petri- dish on ice.

target.text:
Using a W-O p1000 tip, collect all aggregates that are in 1 ml of OM1%M-CH, and transfer into the
OM1%M-CH prepared in petri-dish on ice

source.text:
Using a W-O p1000 tip, collect all aggregates that are in 1 ml of OM1%M-CH, and transfer into the
OM1%M-CH prepared in petri-dish on ice

target.text: Using a W-O p1000 tip, transfer each aggregate in 500 μl of OM1%M-CH into each well in 24-well low- attachment plates (i.e. one aggregate per well in the total volume of 500 μl per well).

source.text: Using a W-O p1000 tip, transfer each aggregate in 500 μl of OM1%M-CH into each well in 24-well low- attachment plates (i.e. one aggregate per well in the total volume of 500 μl per well).

target.text: Gently swirl to make sure each well is completely covered by medium and aggregates are not floating on the surface of the medium.

source.text: Gently swirl to make sure each well is completely covered by medium and aggregates are not floating on the surface of the medium.

target.text: Incubate in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2.

source.text: Differentiation Day 15: Half medium change with OM containing 1% Matrigel and 3 μM CHIR / continued otic vesicle induction

target.text: Remove 250 μl of spent medium from each well of the 24-well plates, leaving 250 μl per well.

source.text: Remove 250 μl of spent medium from each well of the 24-well plates, leaving 250 μl per well.

target.text: Add 250 μl of freshly prepared OM1%M-CH into each well, making a fi nal volume of 500 μl per well.

source.text: 32 ml of OM1%M-CH：To make 1% Matrigel (final concentration, v/v) in 32 ml of OM, remove 320 μl (volume of Matrigel) of OM, and then, add 320 μl of Matrigel.Then, add 9.6 μl CHIR

target.text: Add 250 μl of freshly prepared OM1%M-CH into each well, making a fi nal volume of 500 μl per well.

source.text: Add 250 μl of freshly prepared OM1%M-CH into each well, making a fi nal volume of 500 μl per well.

target.text: Gently swirl the plates to mix the medium

source.text: Gently swirl the plates to mix the medium

target.text: Incubate in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2

source.text: Differentiation Day 18: Half medium change for Matrigel dilution

target.text: Remove 250 μl of spent medium from each well of the 24-well low-attachment plates, leaving 250 μl per well.

source.text: Remove 250 μl of spent medium from each well of the 24-well low-attachment plates, leaving 250 μl per well.

target.text: Add 250 μl of freshly prepared OM into each well, making the fi nal volume of 500 μl per well

source.text: Add 250 μl of freshly prepared OM into each well, making the fi nal volume of 500 μl per well

target.text: Gently swirl the plates to evenly mix the medium

source.text: Gently swirl the plates to evenly mix the medium

target.text: Incubate in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2

source.text: Incubate in the 37°C incubator with 5.0% CO2

target.text: From differentiation day 18 onward, perform a full medium change once every week by completely removing medium (500 μl) from each well and adding back fresh OM (500 μl). Within that one-week period, for experiments up to differentiation day 45, perform half-medium changes every three days (i.e. Full-medium change on Monday, half-medium changes on Thursday and Sunday, then full-medium change on Tuesday). For longer experiments, i.e. after differentiation day 45, perform half medium changes every other day. Also, based on the organoid sizes (i.e. larger) and medium consumption rate (i.e. color of medium changing to yellow), increase total volume to 1 ml per well to provide proper nutrition.
